data.title: Western Influences in Hungary at 1000
data.meta_description:
Western influences in Hungary at 1000.docx - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. - Between 1000-1526, Hungary transitioned from a pagan tribal alliance to a Christian kingdom with strong Western influences. After adopting Catholicism in 975, Hungary strengthened relations with Germany and the Catholic Church. 
- Stephen I (Istvan), who ruled from 1000-1038, solidified Hungary as a Christian kingdom by being crowned by the Pope in 1000. He established a system of counties, built castles, minted coins, and enacted laws based on Western models to centralize power. 
- Western influence continued through the rule of later kings like Coloman and Bela III, who had Western educations. Monks from Germany, Italy and France helped raise cultural standards and introduce new agricultural
